intro: Ageratina badia, commonly known as the whiteface blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its flowers are small and white to pale blue, arranged in dense clusters that give it a fluffy appearance. Ageratina badia is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
